parameters.name: video
parameters.description: Video configuration. Default: video resolution 1280x720, bitrate 2500 kbps, 30 fps. width (integer) --- Video-resolution width. This must be an even number. Note that the maximum value is determined by width times height, such that the maximum total pixels is 2073600 (1920x1080 or 1080x1920). Default: 1280. height (integer) --- Video-resolution height. Default: 720. framerate (float) --- Video frame rate, in fps. Default: 30. bitrate (integer) --- Bitrate for generated output, in bps. Default: 2500000.

nested_params.name: width
nested_params.description: Video-resolution width. This must be an even number. Note that the maximum value is determined by width times height, such that the maximum total pixels is 2073600 (1920x1080 or 1080x1920). Default: 1280.

nested_params.name: height
nested_params.description: Video-resolution height. This must be an even number. Note that the maximum value is determined by width times height, such that the maximum total pixels is 2073600 (1920x1080 or 1080x1920). Default: 720.

nested_params.name: framerate
nested_params.description: Video frame rate, in fps. Default: 30.

nested_params.name: bitrate
nested_params.description: Bitrate for generated output, in bps. Default: 2500000.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Tags attached to the resource. Array of maps, each of the form string:string (key:value). See Best practices and strategies in Tagging AWS Resources and Tag Editor for details, including restrictions that apply to tags and 'Tag naming limits and requirements'; Amazon IVS has no constraints on tags beyond what is documented there. (string) --- (string) ---
